pull.title: Handle new added plurals in bitcoin_en.ts
pull.body:
This step was missed. See [`translation_process.md`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/translation_process.md#handling-plurals-in-source-files).

Transifex is smart enough to handle `%n` in strings as a plural form. Therefore, only two English strings are broken in the GUI on master (and in 22.0).

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

events.message:
qt: Handle new added plurals in bitcoin_en.ts

This step was missed. See translation_process.md

events.body:
Concept ACK

This PR adds the plural translation for the two strings that use plurals but hitherto didn’t had a plural translation. Adding screenshots to compare the difference between the master and the PR.

Screenshots (taken from QT Linguistic):
| Master   |      PR   |
|----------|:-------------:|
| ![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 11-40-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85434418/130401118-8f176081-0fd5-4189-b8d2-382eb641dd6b.png)| ![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 11-41-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85434418/130401144-7849ade9-5b43-4578-8c34-e03431579f84.png) |
| ![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 11-40-32](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85434418/130401188-90c75cc9-3131-4210-86c5-fd9797e95949.png)| ![Screenshot from 2021-08-23 11-42-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85434418/130401212-3c392bb4-e7ee-4df9-917c-247981039be8.png)|
I don't understand, `bitcoin_en.ts` is auto-generated by `make translate`, right?

> I don't understand, `bitcoin_en.ts` is auto-generated by `make translate`, right?

Yes. But `make translate` does not create plural forms (and, I guess, never did it).

That's why we have ["Handling Plurals (in source files)"](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/translation_process.md#handling-plurals-in-source-files) in `translation_process.md`, no?

>  Yes. But make translate does not create plural forms (and, I guess, never did it).

Ok, so `bitcoin_en.ts` is *updated*, not recreated. This is slightly unexpected to me but makes sense.

ACK 2b3d8f3dde383a53f29b7e7ee53ea364d4ef8938
